title: What is the exact weightage of the ISAs?

comments.body:
each ISA you write is out of 20 marks. now they take the best 4 out of the 5 ISAs and take an average of your scores. this is then scaled up to a score out of 30. 

for example: you score an average of 15 in your best 4 out of 5 isas. this is scaled up to 23 out of 30 in your final score. your total ISA is the sum of your CBT tests along with the assignment component which is 20 marks. so your total ISA including the tests and assignments is a score out of 50 which is used for final grade calculations

What our teacher told was 
Each isa is for 20 marks - 5 isas 
Best 4 out of 5
Each iSA's marks will be scaled down to 7.5 and 7.5 * 4 = 30
The other 20 are for assignment
So 30+20 = 50
The other 50 is for esa ( we'll write it for 100 and marks will be scaled down to 50)
